isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - ADJUSTMENTS - CAB AIR RIDE SYSTEM FOR 9200i/9400i/9900i DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES BEFORE DECEMBER 2001

svcproc.title: CAB AIR RIDE SYSTEM FOR 9200 i/9400 i/9900 i DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES BEFORE DECEMBER 2001
svcproc.para: To adjust cab ride height, measure ride height between bottom of air suspension upper mounting plate to top of crossmember the air suspension lower mounting plate is mounted on (Figure 168). If dimension does not meet specified height of 7 3/4 inches (196.9 mm), adjust as necessary using the following procedure.

figure.caption: Figure 168. Cab Height Measuring Points for Cab Air Ride System for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Day Cab Models without Detroit Diesel Engines before December 2001

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 169 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Loosen valve adjuster rod lock bolt (Item 4).

Move horizontal adjuster rod (Item 5) up or down as needed on vertical adjuster rod (Item 6) to achieve correct ride height between bottom of air suspension upper mounting plate and top of air suspension lower mounting plate on crossmember (Figure 168) .
After correct ride height is achieved, tighten valve adjuster rod lock bolt (Item 4).
